column4: Boeing tanker issue may delay U.S. production decision-Air Force
column5: WASHINGTON  March 31 A problem that has prevented Boeing Co 's KC-46A tanker aircraft from transferring fuel to a C-17 transport plane may delay a Pentagon decision approving low-rate production of the new tanker in May  the U.S. Air Force said on Thursday.

column4: Britain's FTSE loses more ground as Q2 begins
column5: LONDON  April 1 Britain's top equity index fell on Friday  dipping at the start of the second quarter of 2016 as weak oil prices weighed on the shares of major energy companies.

column4: UPDATE 2-Dispute over Bouygues role in Orange hampers telecom merger progress - sources

column4: Ackman's fund falls 7 pct in March  hurt by Valeant
column5: BOSTON  April 1 Billionaire investor William Ackman's Pershing Square Holdings  Ltd fund lost 7.1 percent last month  hurt largely by Valeant Pharmaceuticals'  roughly 60 percent tumble in March.
